main_definition: A diploma is a certificate or official document awarded to someone upon completion of an educational course, training program, or degree.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Certificate received at the end of high school in some countries
meanings_and_examples.example: After graduating from high school with honors, John proudly held his diploma.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A document awarded upon completion of a specific course or training program
meanings_and_examples.example: Linda received her culinary arts diploma after attending the prestigious cooking school for six months.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An academic degree awarded by colleges, universities, and other educational institutions upon completion of a course of study
meanings_and_examples.example: After completing his bachelor's degree in computer science, Mark proudly displayed his diploma on the wall.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A symbolic representation of knowledge or skill acquired through education or training
meanings_and_examples.example: The ancient Greek philosophers often referred to their extensive learning as a 'diplomatic' achievement, in modern terms equivalent to a diploma.
